intro: Daboecia cantabrica f. pallida, commonly known as the pale form of the Cantabrian heath, is a shrub native to the northern Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its silver-gray, woolly leaves and clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions. It is a hardy species that prefers full sun and is adapted to harsh, windy conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant in its native habitat.
